title: Orcas Bringing Humans Gifts Of Food
description: Wild orcas have been observed intentionally offering humans pieces of fish, marine mammals, and even seaweed across 34 recorded instances, suggesting a rare form of cross-species cooperative behavior given they thrive on surplus prey. What do you think? The post Orcas Bringing Humans Gifts Of Food appeared first on The Onion.
author: The Onion Staff
excerpt: Wild orcas have been observed intentionally offering humans pieces of fish, marine mammals, and even seaweed across 34 recorded instances, suggesting a rare form of cross-species cooperative behavior given they thrive on surplus prey. What do you think?
text: Wild orcas have been observed intentionally offering humans pieces of fish, marine mammals, and even seaweed across 34 recorded instances, suggesting a rare form of cross-species cooperative behavior given they thrive on surplus prey. What do you think? “My parents always told me not to accept food from orcas I don’t know.” Lily Filippo, Sand Sourcer “I told them, like, 100 times that I’m off harbor seal.” Travis Reis, Coral Bleacher “There’s no such thing as free seaweed.” Mohammed Shehadeh, Skydiving Promoter Like A Vitamin You Ingest With Your Eyes. html:
Wild orcas have been observed intentionally offering humans pieces of fish, marine mammals, and even seaweed across 34 recorded instances, suggesting a rare form of cross-species cooperative behavior given they thrive on surplus prey. What do you think?

“My parents always told me not to accept food from orcas I don’t know.”

Lily Filippo, Sand Sourcer

“I told them, like, 100 times that I’m off harbor seal.”

Travis Reis, Coral Bleacher

“There’s no such thing as free seaweed.”

Mohammed Shehadeh, Skydiving Promoter

Like A Vitamin You Ingest With Your Eyes. Get The Onion Newsletter.

"*" indicates required fields
